Detailed Description

BtCancelableRequest is a child class of BtRequest and implements the common properties for request that can be interrupted. Any further concrete requests that can be canceled are not directly derived from BtRequest. Instead of this they should be child classes of BtCancelableRequest.
See BtRequest for a complete description of Bluetooth requests.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtCancelableRequest::IsCancelable (   )  const [virtual]
 

Can execution of this request be stopped.

So kinds of requests have a very long duration. Most of these requests can be interrupted. Other request once submitted can not be stopped. So IsCancelable returns whether a request can be canceled or not. This function is pure virtual in BtRequest because it depends on the kind of request if it is cancelable. BtCancelableRequest is the base class for all requests that can be interrupted. So IsCancelable can be implemented here to return allways TRUE.

Returns:
TRUE: This request can be canceled.

Implements BtRequest.
